content:
I'd be happy to help you set reminders for your morning routine.

To set reminders for your morning routine, you can follow these steps:

**Breakfast with Sarah:**

* Open your preferred calendar or reminder app (e.g., Google Calendar, Apple Reminders, etc.)
* Create a new event or reminder with the title "Breakfast with Sarah"
* Set the start time to your preferred breakfast time (e.g., 7:30 am)
* Set the duration to a reasonable time (e.g., 30 minutes)
* Select "Every Day" or "Monday to Friday" as the recurring days, depending on your preference
* Set a reminder for 15-30 minutes before the event (or at a time that works for you)
* Save the event or reminder

**Taking Emily to School:**

* Open your preferred calendar or reminder app (e.g., Google Calendar, Apple Reminders, etc.)
* Create a new event or reminder with the title "Take Emily to School"
* Set the start time to the time you need to leave the house to drop off Emily at school (e.g., 8:15 am)
* Set the duration to a short period (e.g., 15 minutes)
* Select "Monday to Friday" as the recurring days
* Set a reminder for 30 minutes before the event (or at a time that works for you)
* Save the event or reminder

Some tips to keep in mind:

* Make sure to set reminders at a time that gives you enough time to get ready and complete each activity.
* You can adjust the reminder time and frequency to fit your specific needs and schedule.
* Consider setting reminders for other morning routine activities, such as exercise, meditation, or reading, to help you stay on track and start your day off right.

By setting reminders for your morning routine, you'll be able to stay organized and ensure that you don't forget about important activities like breakfast with Sarah and taking Emily to school.
